segments.original_transcript: Thank you for calling ITC. This is friend. How may I help you? Hello. Yes, sir. Sir, we need freezing items. Which language are you comfortable with, sir? Telugu? Sir, Kannada, Hindi. Yes, tell me, sir. Sir, I need frozen items for ITC. Frozen snacks, sir? What, sir? Frozen snacks, sir? Yes, frozen snacks. Okay. Are you going to the shop, sir? No, I am going to the cafe. Okay. I need frozen products. I am getting frozen snacks from Mangalore. But I need brownies. Brownies, sir. Brownie cake. Where can I get it? I have it nearby. I need it. Do you need supplies in the cafe, sir? Yes, sir. Did you call for that, sir? Yes, sir. Which products do you have nearby? Which products, sir? Brownie, brownie. Charlie Brownie, sir. ITC Master Chef, sir? Yes, Master Chef Brownie. Please be on line, sir. Let me check. Sir, is the brownie from ITC? Yes, sir. Did you get it before? Yes, I was getting it. I was getting it from Mangalore. I was getting it from Mangalore. But the shop is not coming there. They are not getting it. That's why I called. Where can I get it? Sir, are you asking for snacks or frozen snacks? Frozen snacks. Frozen snacks and brownies, sir? Yes, it has brownies. It's a cake. What's the name of it? Brownie? Brownie cake. Wait a minute, sir. Do you know the name of the brand? It's from Sunfish, sir. Which one, sir? It's from Sunfish, sir. Sunfish, sir? Which brand is it, sir? No, no, sir. It comes in frozen. It comes in the frozen department. Yes. It's not dry. It's a cake kept in the freezer. It's used to make juice. It's from ITC, right? Yes, it's from ITC. It comes in the frozen department. Wait a minute, sir. You are waiting in the queue. Wait a minute, sir. You are waiting in the queue. Are you comfortable in Hindi, sir? Yes, sir. I know. What's your name? Prashank. Is this your mobile number? Yes, it is. Do you have any other mobile number or email id? Yes, sir. This is the number. You have called for the coffee supply, right? Yes, sir. Did you get it from the third party? You are not getting it now. Yes, sir. I am not getting it there either. Where will I get it? Wait a minute, sir. I will check the details and let you know. For this, I will put your call on hold for 1-2 minutes. Okay, sir. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Give it to me. Give it to me. Give it to me. What? I am calling the police. Give it to me. Give it to me. Hello. Hello, Dhanava Desai. Your call has been transferred to the Kannada agent. Yes, sir. Sir, your call has been transferred to the Kannada agent. Tell me. Yes, sir. What is it? Okay. Prawns? Okay. Brownie? Brownie. Brownie. Brownie. Brownie. B-R-O W-N-A Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Shashank. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay. Hello.

summary: The caller, Prashank, wants to know where he can find ITC Master Chef Brownie and other frozen snacks for a cafe he owns. The friend offers to help him but first asks which language he would prefer. They switch to Kannada and the friend takes down the details of the call and puts him on hold while they check the details of the caller's query. After a few minutes, the friend tells Prashank that they need more information about the products he needs and they will help him if he calls the relevant department. The call is transferred to the new department where the agent, Dhanava Desai, helps Prashank with his queries.  They manage to find a brownie option for him, which the caller repeats several times to confirm, and also helps him with another frozen snack of prawns that the caller also needs.  At the end of the call, the friend thanks Prashank for calling ITC.  The call ends.  There is a lot of background noise and the tone used by the friend and agent is polite and professional throughout the call.  The entire conversation is in Kannada.
cohere_points:
- A customer is calling an ITC retailer to help him find a specific brand of frozen snacks and brownies for his caf√©, but despite checking their inventory, they cannot find the specific product
- The customer grows frustrated with the call as they are put on hold several times
- The call becomes problematic when the customer is asked to switch to another language agent and they hang up the phone midway through the call
Topic:
1. Customer inquiry about frozen products
2. Language preference
3. Request for brownie cake
4. Searching for ITC Master Chef brownie
5. Difficulty in finding the product
6. Assistance with supply for cafe
7. Verification of caller details
8. Transfer to Kannada agent
9. Inventory check for brownie availability
10. Putting call on hold for checking
Resolution: The customer's issue has not been resolved as they are still waiting for information on where to find the specific brownie product they are looking for.
Did the caller Displayed Empathy:
Yes, the caller displayed empathy. 
The caller displayed empathy by patiently listening to the customer's needs and offering assistance in finding the specific product, showing understanding of the customer's frustration in not being able to locate the brownies, and assuring the customer that they will check the details and assist in finding the product.
